# yieldActivation(to:)

**Instance Method**

Explicitly allows another app to make itself active.

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor func yieldActivation(to application: NSRunningApplication)
```

## Parameters

- **application**: The app to yield activation state to.

## Discussion

Calling this method doesn’t deactivate the yielding app, nor does it activate the  app you yield to. For cooperative activation, the other app must request activation in the future by calling [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSApplication/activate()] or equivalent.

## Activating and deactivating the app

- **Passing control from one app to another with cooperative activation**: Request focus for your app, and coordinate passing control from one app to another.
- **activate()**: Activates the receiver app, if appropriate.
- **deactivate()**: Deactivates the receiver.
- **isActive**: A Boolean value indicating whether this is the active app.
- **yieldActivation(toApplicationWithBundleIdentifier:)**: Explicitly allows another app to make itself active.
- **NSApplication.ActivationOptions**: The following flags are for [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSRunningApplication/activate(options:)].

items.description: Request focus for your app, and coordinate passing control from one app to another.
